page.title: 12 Longhill Primary School
page.content:
Longhill Primary School was built in 1954. It is made of brick,concrete panels and glass, and has flat roofs. When it opened the youngest children at the school were 5 years old and the oldest were 11.
In February 1957 the school had the most children it had ever had-793. There were 17 teachers and a head teacher. The smallest class was taught by a part-time teacher and had 26 children, but the other classes had between 42 and 52 children.
In 1985 the youngest children attend the nursery which was started in 1978 in a converted block of 4 classrooms. They are three years old.
